channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report E-2024010352
item.description:
Report E-2024010352

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: YEMASSEE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 12, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2735 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed that R+L had already overpacked the leaking pail, placed absorbents to the spill location. FCE personnel deployed a PH test to the unattended for areas reading a 12. The onsite supervisor informed FCE that no further action would be needed and R+L would finish cleaning the spill in the future.

item.title: Report E-2024010341
item.description:
Report E-2024010341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: WELLFORD
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of Xylene (UN1170) was released from four 1-gallon plastic jugs due to a forklift accident when the containers fell off the pallet. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 7. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, the SDS indicated there was a respiratory hazard that required a respirator for clean-up and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 15 gallon DM contains four 1-gallon plastic ugs of Xylene and oil dri was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010334
item.description:
Report E-2024010334

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: NORTH AUGUSTA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately .5 cups of Formic acid (Kleen MCT115) released from a 5 gallon jug due to a forklift loading incident. The release only impacted the pail and the pallet. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and advised terminal personnel to clean it up based on the sds. (1) 30 gallon DF contains oil dry, and one jug of product was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010190
item.description:
Report X-2024010190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: FORT MILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON THE VAN LINE WITH A STRONG SMELLING AROMA COMING FROM IT. THE ADMIN ON THE BELT TOOK IT OFF OF THE VAN SCAN TO INVESTIGATE. SHE FOUND THAT THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND TO HER SURPRISE WAS A HAZMAT ON THE INSIDE OF THE OUTER BOX. THE OUTER BOX HAD NO MARKINGS OR HAZMAT LABELS, BUT THE INSIDE BOX HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABEL AND A UN NUMBER ON IT. SHE PLACED IT IN A HAZMAT TOTE TO BE INVESTIGATED FURTHER. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FAILURE WAS IN THE CLOSURE. ONE OF THE GALLONS LEAKED OUT THE PRODUCT INSIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND CLOSED SO THAT THE AROMA/ VAPORS WERE NO LONGER IN THE AIR.
